items.name: Ext.form.action.Action
items.text: The subclasses of this class provide actions to perform upon Ext.form.Basics. Instances of this class are only created by a Ext.form.Basic when the Form needs to perform an action such as submit or load. The Configuration options listed for this class are set through the Form's action methods: Ext.form.Basic#submit, Ext.form.Basic#load and Ext.form.Basic#doAction The instance of Action which performed the action is passed to the success and failure callbacks of the Form's action methods (Ext.form.Basic#submit, Ext.form.Basic#load and Ext.form.Basic#doAction), and to the Ext.form.Basic#actioncomplete and Ext.form.Basic#actionfailed event handlers.

items.name: failure
items.text:
The function to call when a failure packet was received, or when an error
occurred in the Ajax communication.

items.name: form
items.text: The form that requested the action

items.name: action
items.text: The Action class. If an Ajax error occurred, the failure type will be in failureType. The result property of this object may be examined to perform custom post-processing.

items.name: form
items.text: The Ext.form.Basic instance that is invoking this Action. Required.

items.name: headers
items.text: Extra headers to be sent in the AJAX request for submit and load actions. See Ext.data.proxy.Ajax#headers. **Note:** Headers are not sent during file upload.

items.name: method
items.text: The HTTP method to use to access the requested URL. Defaults to the Ext.form.Basic#method, or 'POST' if not specified.

items.name: params
items.text: Extra parameter values to pass. These are added to the Form's Ext.form.Basic#baseParams and passed to the specified URL along with the Form's input fields. Parameters are encoded as standard HTTP parameters using Ext#urlEncode.

items.name: reset
items.text: When set to **true**, causes the Form to be Ext.form.Basic#reset on Action success. If specified, this happens before the success callback is called and before the Form's Ext.form.Basic#actioncomplete event fires.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope in which to call the configured #success and #failure callback functions
(the `this` reference for the callback functions).

items.name: submitEmptyText
items.text: If set to true, the emptyText value will be sent with the form when it is submitted.

items.name: success
items.text: The function to call when a valid success return packet is received.

items.name: form
items.text: The form that requested the action

items.name: action
items.text: The Action class. The result property of this object may be examined to perform custom post-processing.

items.name: timeout
items.text: The number of seconds to wait for a server response before failing with the failureType as Ext.form.action.Action#CONNECT_FAILURE. If not specified, defaults to the configured Ext.form.Basic#timeout of the form.

items.name: url
items.text: The URL that the Action is to invoke. Will default to the Ext.form.Basic#url configured on the form.

items.name: waitMsg
items.text: The message to be displayed by a call to Ext.window.MessageBox#wait during the time the action is being processed.

items.name: waitTitle
items.text: The title to be displayed by a call to Ext.window.MessageBox#wait during the time the action is being processed.

items.name: constructor
items.text: Creates new Action.

items.name: config
items.text: Config object.

items.name: createCallback
items.text: Creates a callback object.

items.name: getMethod
items.text: Determine the HTTP method to be used for the request.
The HTTP method

items.name: getParams
items.text:
Get the set of parameters specified in the BasicForm's baseParams and/or the params option.
Items in params override items of the same name in baseParams.
the full set of parameters

items.name: getUrl
items.text: Build the URL for the AJAX request. Used by the standard AJAX submit and load actions.
The URL.

items.name: handleResponse
items.text: Handles the raw response and builds a result object from it. Must be implemented by subclasses.

items.name: hasOwnProperty
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

Returns true if object contains specified property; else
returns false.

items.name: isPrototypeOf
prototype
items.text:
an object to be tested against each link in the prototype chain of the
*object* argument

items.name: object
items.text: the object whose prototype chain will be searched
Returns true if object is a prototype and false if not.

items.name: onFailure
items.text: Handles a failure response.

items.name: onSuccess
items.text: Callback method that gets invoked when the action completes successfully. Must be implemented by subclasses.

items.name: processResponse
items.text: Validates that a response contains either responseText or responseXML and invokes handleResponse to build the result object.

items.name: response
items.text: The raw response object.

The result object as built by handleResponse, or `true` if
the response had empty responseText and responseXML.

items.name: propertyIsEnumerable
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

If the object does not have the specified property, this
method returns false.

items.name: run
items.text: Invokes this action using the current configuration.

items.name: toLocaleString
items.text: Returns a string representing the object. This method is meant to be overridden by derived objects for locale-specific purposes. Objects toLocaleString returns the result of calling toString. This function is provided to give objects a generic toLocaleString method, even though not all may use it. Currently, only Array, Number, and Date override toLocaleString.
Object represented as a string.

items.name: toString

items.text: Object represented as a string.

items.name: valueOf
items.text: Returns the primitive value of the specified object. JavaScript calls the valueOf method to convert an object to a primitive value. You rarely need to invoke the valueOf method yourself; JavaScript automatically invokes it when encountering an object where a primitive value is expected. By default, the valueOf method is inherited by every object descended from Object. Every built- in core object overrides this method to return an appropriate value. If an object has no primitive value, valueOf returns the object itself, which is displayed as: [object Object] You can use valueOf within your own code to convert a built-in object into a primitive value. When you create a custom object, you can override `Object.valueOf` to call a custom method instead of the default Object method. You can create a function to be called in place of the default valueOf method. Your function must take no arguments. Suppose you have an object type `myNumberType` and you want to create a valueOf method for it. The following code assigns a user-defined function to the object's valueOf method: myNumberType.prototype.valueOf = new Function(functionText) With the preceding code in place, any time an object of type `myNumberType` is used in a context where it is to be represented as a primitive value, JavaScript automatically calls the function defined in the preceding code. An object's valueOf method is usually invoked by JavaScript, but you can invoke it yourself as follows: myNumber.valueOf() Note: Objects in string contexts convert via the toString method, which is different from String objects converting to string primitives using valueOf. All objects have a string conversion, if only `"[object type]"`. But many objects do not convert to number, boolean, or function.
Returns value of the object or the object itself.

items.name: constructor
failureType
prototype
items.text: Allows the addition of properties to all objects of type Object.

items.name: response
items.text: The raw XMLHttpRequest object used to perform the action.

items.name: result
items.text: The decoded response object containing a boolean success property and other, action-specific properties.

items.name: type
items.text: The type of action this Action instance performs. Currently only "submit" and "load" are supported.

items.name: CLIENT_INVALID
items.text: Failure type returned when client side validation of the Form fails thus aborting a submit action. Client side validation is performed unless Ext.form.action.Submit#clientValidation is explicitly set to false.

items.name: CONNECT_FAILURE
items.text: Failure type returned when a communication error happens when attempting to send a request to the remote server. The response may be examined to provide further information.

items.name: LOAD_FAILURE
items.text: Failure type returned when the response's success property is set to false, or no field values are returned in the response's data property.

items.name: SERVER_INVALID
items.text: Failure type returned when server side processing fails and the results success property is set to false. In the case of a form submission, field-specific error messages may be returned in the results errors property.
